Notes: The AMA has assembled an impressive and growing permanent collection comprised of African, European, and American art. The collection includes 2,400 original works of art with more than 200 works on display at any given time. The Museum houses one of the largest collections of sub-Saharan African art in the Southeastern United States. This collection, much of which was donated by Ms. Stella Davis, anchors the museumÆs permanent collection and has been a resource for thousands of visitors. Holdings include a wealth of masks, sculpture, pottery, baskets, textiles, jewelry and gold weights. The American and European collections include paintings, drawings, photographs, and sculpture. The American collection includes paintings by Edward Pothast, Joseph Sharp, Ernest Lawson, Reginald Marsh and A.L. Ripley.
